type.name: section
type.title: Short title.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Short title. 1. This Act may be cited as the Investment Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Investment Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Interpretation. 2. (1) In this Act  domestic investor means  (i) a citizen of Guyana;  (ii) a body   corporate   established   in   Guyana   in conformity with the laws thereof and which is substantially owned and controlled by citizens of Guyana; LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 73:03 Investment                            Objectives.                          (iii) citizen of any other Member State of the Caribbean Community established under the Treaty done at Chaguaramas on 4th July, 1973;  foreign investor means an investor, not being a domestic investor; investment  enterprise means an enterprise owned by an investor or investors;  investor means a natural or juridical person investing capital in Guyana on the basis of mutual benefit and observance of the laws of Guyana;  Minister means the Minister responsible for Finance.

type.name: section
type.title: Government encouragement of investment.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Government encouragement of investment. 4. (1)  The Government encourages  and seeks to  facilitate persons, either individuals or legal entities, to invest capital in Guyana on the basis of mutual benefit and observance of the laws of Guyana and international treaties or agreements to which the State or Government is a party.  (2) There shall be no discrimination between foreign and domestic investors nor among foreign investors from different countries.

description.description: The Government encourages  and seeks to  facilitate persons, either individuals or legal entities, to invest capital in Guyana on the basis of mutual benefit and observance of the laws of Guyana and international treaties or agreements to which the State or Government is a party.
There shall be no discrimination between foreign and domestic investors nor among foreign investors from different countries.

type.name: section
type.title: Fields of activity open to investors.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Fields of activity open to investors. 5. (1) Investors may invest in and operate enterprises in all fields of lawful economic activity including in particular, but not limited to agriculture, fisheries and forestry, manufacturing, energy, mineral extraction, handicrafts,   communications   and   transport, construction, tourism, trade, and professional services,  except for sectors which may be determined by the Minister, which shall be subject to affirmative resolution of the National Assembly.  (2) Notification of the approval of the National Assembly pursuant to subsection (1) shall be published as soon as practicable in the Gazette.

type.name: section
type.title: Fields of activity closed to investors.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Fields of activity closed to investors. 6. Investors   shall   not   invest   in   or   operate   investment enterprises which are prejudicial to national security, or detrimental to the natural environment, or public health, or which contravene the laws of Guyana.
type.description: Investors   shall   not   invest   in   or   operate   investment enterprises which are prejudicial to national security, or detrimental to the natural environment, or public health, or which contravene the laws of Guyana.

type.name: section
type.title: Joint Ventures.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Joint Ventures. 8. The organisation, management  and  activities  of  a  joint venture and the relationship of its parties shall be governed by the contract entered into by the parties thereto and the Articles of Association of the joint venture, in accordance with the laws of Guyana.
type.description: The organisation, management  and  activities  of  a  joint venture and the relationship of its parties shall be governed by the contract entered into by the parties thereto and the Articles of Association of the joint venture, in accordance with the laws of Guyana.

type.name: section
type.title: Contribution of capital to Foreign Joint Ventures.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Contribution of capital to Foreign Joint Ventures. 9. Investors investing in a joint venture may contribute any portion of the total equity investment in that venture. If a joint venture has a foreign investor or investors, for the purposes of establishing value, the contribution of the ventures foreign investor or investors shall be converted in accordance with the laws of Guyana into Guyana Dollars at the exchange buying rate then prevailing on the date of the equity payment or payments, as quoted by the Bank of Guyana.

type.title: Incorporation, registration or establishment.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Incorporation, registration or establishment. 10. The incorporation, registration, or establishment   of an investment enterprise shall be in accordance with the Companies Act, the Partnership Act, the Business Names (Registration) Act, or the Cooperative Societies Act.
type.description: The incorporation, registration, or establishment   of an investment enterprise shall be in accordance with the Companies Act, the Partnership Act, the Business Names (Registration) Act, or the Cooperative Societies Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Government protection of investment.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Government protection of investment. 13. The Government shall protect investments and the property of investors in accordance with the laws of Guyana.
type.description: The Government shall protect investments and the property of investors in accordance with the laws of Guyana.

type.title: Compulsory acquisition by Government.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Compulsory acquisition by Government. 14. type.name: section
type.title: Leasing and owning land.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Leasing and owning land. 15. Subject to the laws for the time being in force, investors may purchase or lease land in Guyana and dispose of or transfer their interests in or rights over the land.
type.description: Subject to the laws for the time being in force, investors may purchase or lease land in Guyana and dispose of or transfer their interests in or rights over the land.

type.name: section
type.title: Non-intervention by Government.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Non-intervention by Government. 16. Notwithstanding the provisions of the Trade Act, the Government shall not intervene in the management of investment enterprises; nor shall the Government impose conditions on the sale, pricing, or distribution of the products of those enterprises, except in the pricing of services provided by utilities.
type.description: Notwithstanding the provisions of the Trade Act, the Government shall not intervene in the management of investment enterprises; nor shall the Government impose conditions on the sale, pricing, or distribution of the products of those enterprises, except in the pricing of services provided by utilities.

type.name: section
type.title: Free export and import.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Free export and import. 17. (1) Notwithstanding the provisions of the Trade Act, the Government shall guarantee the rights of investors and investment enterprises to import or export all or any products free from restriction or limitation, except for products the ownership or possession of which is prohibited by law, or products which may be determined by the Minister and which shall be subject to affirmative resolution of the National Assembly.  (2) Notification of the approval of the National Assembly pursuant to subsection (1) shall be published as soon as practicable in the Gazette. type.name: section
type.title: Right to profit distribution.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Right to profit distribution. 18. The Government hereby guarantees the right of investors and investment enterprises, irrespective of their form, to freely determine the distribution of all profits or dividends, and the right of investors to receive their total share in such profits or dividends providing the corresponding tax obligations of the investors and investment enterprise are satisfied.
type.description: The Government hereby guarantees the right of investors and investment enterprises, irrespective of their form, to freely determine the distribution of all profits or dividends, and the right of investors to receive their total share in such profits or dividends providing the corresponding tax obligations of the investors and investment enterprise are satisfied.

type.name: section
type.title: Employment of foreign personnel.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Employment of foreign personnel. 19. Investment enterprises have the right to employ skilled and expert foreign personnel when necessary and with the approval of the competent authority of the Government in compliance with the Immigration Act and the Labour Act.
type.description: Investment enterprises have the right to employ skilled and expert foreign personnel when necessary and with the approval of the competent authority of the Government in compliance with the Immigration Act and the Labour Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Entry and exit.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Entry and exit. 20. The Government shall facilitate the entry into, stay in, and departure from Guyana of investors, their foreign personnel, and their immediate family members in accordance with the Immigration Act, but such persons are subject to and must comply with the laws of Guyana while they are in Guyana.
type.description: The Government shall facilitate the entry into, stay in, and departure from Guyana of investors, their foreign personnel, and their immediate family members in accordance with the Immigration Act, but such persons are subject to and must comply with the laws of Guyana while they are in Guyana.

type.name: section
type.title: Work permits.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Work permits. 21. The Government shall facilitate foreign investors and foreign personnel of investors in obtaining work permits in compliance with the Immigration Act.
type.description: The Government shall facilitate foreign investors and foreign personnel of investors in obtaining work permits in compliance with the Immigration Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Tax obligations.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Tax obligations. 22. Foreign personnel employed in investment enterprises and their families shall pay taxes, duties or other imposts for which they are liable pursuant to the laws of Guyana.
type.description: Foreign personnel employed in investment enterprises and their families shall pay taxes, duties or other imposts for which they are liable pursuant to the laws of Guyana.

type.name: section
type.title: Bank accounts.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Bank accounts. 23. Investors may open accounts in the currency of Guyana and in foreign convertible  currency  with  any  corporate  body licensed to carry on banking business in Guyana under the Banking Act.
type.description: Investors may open accounts in the currency of Guyana and in foreign convertible  currency  with  any  corporate  body licensed to carry on banking business in Guyana under the Banking Act.

type.title: Transfer of funds abroad.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Transfer of funds abroad. 24. type.name: section
type.title: Right of personnel and dependants to transfer funds abroad.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Right of personnel and dependants to transfer funds abroad. 26. Foreign personnel employed in investment enterprises and their families may also repatriate their earnings, after payment of personal income taxes imposed by law in Guyana and all other taxes due, except when any of the conditions under section 25 exists.
type.description: Foreign personnel employed in investment enterprises and their families may also repatriate their earnings, after payment of personal income taxes imposed by law in Guyana and all other taxes due, except when any of the conditions under section 25 exists.

type.name: section
type.title: Intellectual property rights.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Intellectual property rights. 27. The intellectual property rights of investors and investment enterprises are guaranteed under the applicable laws of Guyana.
type.description: The intellectual property rights of investors and investment enterprises are guaranteed under the applicable laws of Guyana.

type.name: section
type.title: Dispute resolution.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Dispute resolution. 28. (1) In the event of disputes among foreign investors within an investment enterprise, or among foreign investors and domestic investors, or among Guyanese investors, or between the investors  and  the  Government  with  respect  to  an  investment enterprise, the parties to the dispute shall first seek to settle their disputes through consultation or meditation in order to reach an amicable settlement.  (2)  If parties to the dispute fail to resolve the matter, they may  (a) submit their dispute to arbitration under the Arbitration Act;  (b) invoke  the  jurisdiction  of  the  competent courts in Guyana;  (c) adopt such other procedure provided for in the articles of association or other constituent document of the investment enterprise; or  LAWS OF GUYANA 14 Cap. 73:03 Investment           Obligations of investors to adhere to environmental health and safety laws. c. 20:01             Obligation of investigators to adhere to the National Standards of Guyana. c.90:15   Union representation, social insurance and welfare. c.36:01 c.98:07    Accounting standards and audit.   (d) submit their  dispute  to  the  International Centre for the Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID) of which Guyana is a member.

type.name: section
type.title: Obligations of investors to adhere to environment, health and safety laws.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Obligations of investors to adhere to environment, health and safety laws. 29. Investors shall conduct their operations in accordance with the laws of Guyana and in particular, take all measures necessary and appropriate to ensure that the facilities, factories, products and activities of their investment enterprises protect  (a) the  natural  environment   as  mandated  by  the Environmental Protection Act; and  (b) the health and safety of workers and the general public under the applicable laws of Guyana.

description.description: the  natural  environment   as  mandated  by  the Environmental Protection Act; and
the health and safety of workers and the general public under the applicable laws of Guyana.

type.name: section
type.title: Obligation of investors to adhere to the National Standards of Guyana.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Obligation of investors to adhere to the National Standards of Guyana. 30. In accordance with the Guyana National Bureau of Standards Act, investors shall comply with the standards of the Guyana National Bureau of Standards regarding the importation of products and investment equipment and in their outputs.
type.description: In accordance with the Guyana National Bureau of Standards Act, investors shall comply with the standards of the Guyana National Bureau of Standards regarding the importation of products and investment equipment and in their outputs.

type.name: section
type.title: Union representation, social insurance and welfare.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Union representation, social insurance and welfare. 31. In accordance with the Trade Union Recognition Act, investors shall grant union recognition at any site of operations if the majority of their employees indicate the desire for union representation. Investment enterprises shall contribute to the social insurance and welfare programme for their workers in accordance with the National Insurance Act.
type.description: In accordance with the Trade Union Recognition Act, investors shall grant union recognition at any site of operations if the majority of their employees indicate the desire for union representation. type.name: section
type.title: Taxation.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Taxation. 33. Investors shall pay all relevant taxes, except as exempted under any law.
type.description: Investors shall pay all relevant taxes, except as exempted under any law.

type.name: section
type.title: Sovereign immunity.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Sovereign immunity. 34. In accordance with the provisions of the State Liability and Proceedings Act, the Government shall not assert or claim any right of sovereign immunity in relation to its activities as a domestic investor, or its commercial activities in respect of an investment enterprise, or in relation to any investment or commercial dispute.
type.description: In accordance with the provisions of the State Liability and Proceedings Act, the Government shall not assert or claim any right of sovereign immunity in relation to its activities as a domestic investor, or its commercial activities in respect of an investment enterprise, or in relation to any investment or commercial dispute.

type.name: section
type.title: Investment priority categories.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Investment priority categories. 36. Investment   priority categories shall   be detailed in Priority Lists as set out in section 2 of the Income Tax (In Aid of Industry) Act.
type.description: Investment   priority categories shall   be detailed in Priority Lists as set out in section 2 of the Income Tax (In Aid of Industry) Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Publication of incentives granted.
type.context: INVESTMENT ACT under Publication of incentives granted. 37. The Government shall publish in the Gazette information regarding all fiscal incentives granted under section 2 of the Income Tax (In Aid of Industry) Act.
type.description: The Government shall publish in the Gazette information regarding all fiscal incentives granted under section 2 of the Income Tax (In Aid of Industry) Act.

Go-Invest shall provide investors with all forms necessary to apply for incentives and assist investors in completing forms accurately.
